Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed took four wickets for 25 in the match, his best performance in T20Is.
Hasan Mahmud took two wickets for Bangladesh.
Yasir Ali took a catch at the first slip and Nurul Hasan took a regulation catch to dismiss the second wicket.
Tom Cooper was dismissed for a duck in the fourth over.
Colin Ackermann scored a heroic knock for the Netherlands, but it was not enough.
Soumya Sarkar defended the last over, conceding 14 runs with a six and a wicket off the last ball of the match.
Mustafizur Rahman conceded only eight runs in the last over.
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh will be full of confidence to play their second T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa on October 27 in Sydney.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh registered their first win in the Super 12 stage of the T20 World Cup 2022.
The Netherlands lost two wickets in the very first two balls of their innings.
